intro: Eruca vesicaria, commonly known as garden cress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like broccoli and mustard. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers and pinnate leaves that are often used in salads or as a garnish. Its seeds are also edible and can be used in various culinary applications. Eruca vesicaria thrives in cool climates and is often grown in gardens for both ornamental and edible purposes.
